metadata.title: CVE-2017-2924 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in theread_legacy_biff function of FreeXL 1.0.3. A specially crafted XLS file cancause a memory corruption resulting in remote code execution. An attackercan send malicious XLS file to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfreexl1 - 1.0.0g-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freexl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.0g-1ubuntu0.14.04.3').
